description: The Children Education Allowance scheme in Nagaland provides financial support to the children of state government employees to cover educational expenses from primary to higher secondary levels. The scheme aims to ensure access to quality education for the children of government servants.
key_features: Financial allowance for children of state government employees
Covers primary to higher secondary education
Reimburses educational expenses like fees and uniforms

benefits.allowance_amount: As per Nagaland government norms (typically monthly or annual reimbursement)
benefits.coverage: School fees, uniforms, books, and other educational expenses

education_criteria: Children studying in primary, secondary, or higher secondary classes
Must be enrolled in recognized schools
additional_criteria: Parent must be a permanent employee of the Nagaland state government
Applicable for up to two children per employee
institution_criteria: Government or recognized private schools in India

steps: Obtain application form from the parent’s department or Nagaland government office
Submit form with proof of educational expenses and required documents
Allowance disbursed to the employee’s account
application_process.note: Submit applications as per departmental guidelines

special_notes: Limited to two children per employee
Allowance amount subject to government norms and budget
Reimbursement requires submission of valid expense receipts
